Mr. Marion Corwell
page 2
April 16, 1963
I realize that this does not entirely answer your questions,
however, I think a questionnaire posing the question of Federal
aid to TV compiled from the various states through the members
of NAEB would be a great asset in the furtherance of public
relations between the Federal government and the progress of
ETV. Of course, the other preliminaries used in a questionnaire
of this nature with regard to a manâ€™s position in life, his civic
activities, etc. should be inserted.
If there are any additional questions you would like to
pose, please let me know. I might add that I have used in all
of my talks to P.T.A. groups and clubs definite statements
approving Federal aid in the field of ETV and thus far I have
received no criticism. I am also certain it is acceptable by
Arkansas because we passed an appropriation for $250,000 Federal
funds, if and when available, by a vote of 86-0 in the House
this last Session.
With regard to the meeting at Columbus Institute this year,
at this time I would say that it is possible for me to attend.
However, should the meeting be set, I would like to know at
lease 60 days prior to the meeting so that I can make the necessary
arrangements.
Best regards.
Chairman
Educational Television Commission
